name: Glenelg Beach Hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel during WOMAD festival. We booked for two nights but ended staying only one night as the room we booked has no windows at all and very very small (althought it was a triple room for two persons!). We upgraded to their family room with a window which cost the same as in a decent hotel.
reviews.title: careful with the cancellation policy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a loud band playing in the semi-basement with no sound insulation at all so imagine.., we were lucky the band played quite good. We had no other choice than staying a night since I could not get back my payment for two nights. Their policy is no cancellation refund for 40 hours, so if you don't like the rooms then badluck, 2 nights money from your credit card is gone. My advice is to view the room first before paying.
reviews.title: Lovely seaside town

likes.disliked: — No hot water in bathroom taps

reviews.title: Adelaide's Beach Resort
reviews.text: The good thing, spring beds are very comfortable. The building is an old beauty, which with a bit of imagination & refurbishment could be a lot better hostel.

Lots of really negative reviews here. And I kinda understand, but like one guy say it's more about the location than anything else. Glenelg is a nice little suburb, and your only 15 seconds from the beach at this place. I quite liked the bar, and didn't have any major probelms with music being too loud (except the evening when a local Aussie Rules football team was partying there - was a fun evening). Rooms were clean and simple. Maybe a little overpriced, and paying for internet is annoying
reviews.title: Come on guys, it's not that bad!

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights in a single room during winter. The room had a single bed and a bare light bulb, nothing else. No chair, no table, nothing. It also had no heating and only a thin blanket on the bed. I asked the person at the bar/reception for a couple more blankets as I felt I might freeze overnight, and after making some excuses, a couple of hours and making me feel like I was causing problems, I finally collected 2 blankets which was only just enough to keep me warm. Until late at night the bar pumped out loud and annoying dance music. The showers were dirty, the carpet was stained and smelt. Seriously, stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you plan on sleeping
Great location - amazing beach lifestyle!
reviews.text: I read the reviews of this property but I was determined to stay by the beach in Adelaide nonetheless. I was gladly surprised to find the the old building charming and only a stones throw from the historical Glenelg beach. The area had a number of restaurants and bars including a marina with views up and down the coast. I was also able to visit the city sights easily for a day using the tram that ran directly into the centre. My only criticism would be the number of 'long term' guests that stay there who can be slightly exhausting but after a few drinks in the bar downstairs everyone is friends.

if you want a hostel with a bar, near to bars and the beach, this is probably a good choice. I wasn't too keen on Glenelg in general, as it was a bit like Bournemouth or Swindon (no offence). The hostel had big rooms without bunks, which was a nice change. It felt a little impersonal; kitchen was small, TV room average. Attached to part of a heaving pub, and very close to other (not so great) pubs. Great if your out on the pull!
reviews.title: Good for partying, that's about it!

reviews.text: All the negative comments of other reviews are justified - the sprawling building is difficult to navigate, the bar is very noisy at night and the owner is a bit of a pest towards female travellers. I would add that I found the whole place rather smelly although they were obviously trying to keep it clean. It smelt like a pub the morning after. I paid A$60 for a private room which was small and spartan, but with clean crisp linen and a window. The toilet was far away however.
reviews.title: Swallow your principles - you`re paying for location!

reviews.text: Located just steps from the Tram stop and beach in Glenelg, this is the perfect place to stay in Adelaide. The rooms are fan cooled and have single beds instead of bunks so you don't feel so crammed in. Staff was friendly and helpful. Kitchen and common room were adequate, though the floors have seen better days. there's a liscenced bar on premises, and a nice common area in the back. Was great for a few days stay!
reviews.title: Great Hostel, Great Location

reviews.text: Having been to Adelaide a few times, I prefer staying in the bay as opposed to the city, plus the tram is half a block from the hostel and takes you directly to the center when needed. Rooms are average for a hostel and could use more plugs. Bed was comfy enough and bathrooms fine. There is a great bar/common area and outside courtyard. The owner is very friendly and the hostel has a social atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great bar and location

reviews.text: If you're a traveller, don't think of changing your plans; don't get sick; or let anyone in your family get sick. Unless you give 48 hours notice to the Glenelg Beach Hostel you will still be charged the full cost of the room.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!

reviews.text: 100% of the cost of the room despite 48 hours notice? What's that about?
reviews.title: basic, amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for BDO in Adelaide but were sorely disappointed with the quality of this hostel compared to others we had previously stayed at in the CBD area. Since we were staying the BDO weekend we were charged AU$80 for the double room for the night, compared to the standard rate of AU$70. The double room was fairly small and had a ceiling fan. Our main issue was with the bathroom / toilets. Both were mixed yet some of the showers were lacking shower curtains and both were generally in a grotty state. We ended up only staying one night and packing up early the next morning as we were so keen to leave and have a decent shower.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Glenelg is a nice area but it's worth considering staying in the city and catching the tram to and from Glenelg if you wish to spend some time at the beach.
reviews.title: Was it a hostel or a bar...?

reviews.text: This place couldnt make its mind up as to what it was.. The reception was the bar, and the bar was also the 'TV' room. So you couldn't watch TV in the evening because the 'DJ' in the bar was playing very loud music to himself.
reviews.title: Bed on the beach? don't bother

reviews.text: The Kitchen was OK but set out over 2 levels and the fridge was on it's last legs.
reviews.title: was once better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room just had two bunk beds in it and a fan, no lockers, no hooks, no chair, no table. It was ok, the matress was well worn but we've slept on worse.
reviews.title: Nice, old building but rundown and dirty

description: Adelaide's only beachside backpackers hostel, housed in a beautiful heritage building with high lofty ceilings, period features and open fireplaces. Female only, mixed dorms and private rooms available, all with linen and light breakfast included. Full facilities including 24hr backpackers TV lounge, kitchen, internet cafe, laundry, licensed bar and beer garden on site. visiting Adelaide... stay at the beach!
